title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
Tensions over Ukraine sent U.S. stocks lower as investors sought the safety of government bonds. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow fell 1.9%, 2.8% and 1.4%, respectively. Oil prices jumped.

---

Cisco Systems has made a takeover offer worth more than $20 billion for software maker Splunk, in what would be the networking giant's biggest acquisition ever.

---

The inventory crunch of dealership lots is turning the used-car market upside down, with once-depreciating vehicles rising in value and some recently purchased ones worth more than their original price.

---

Two senior Fed staffers reported a series of financial market trades in early 2020, as the central bank swung into action with its pandemic stimulus effort.

---

Apollo Global is nearing a deal to acquire the point-of-sale terminal business of European payments company Worldline for close to $2.3 billion.

Apollo reported lower fourth-quarter profit, as the investment firm's private-equity portfolio underperformed the broader market.

---

Goodyear lost more than a quarter of its market value after the tire manufacturer said it expects significant pressure from rising input prices to persist into 2022.
